intro: Roebuckia cheilocarpa var. quobbensis, commonly known as the quobbens flaxflower, is a rare and striking member of the Aizoaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires minimal water, making it well adapted to its harsh environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
